title: INFINITY Project Kick-off Meeting in Bologna
content: We are pleased to announce Time Machine Organisation’s participation in the INFINITY project, a major European initiative dedicated to advancing innovation and collaboration within the cultural heritage sector. INFINITY contributes to the European Collaborative Cloud for Cultural Heritage (ECCCH) by developing tools and methods that improve the lifecycle management and ethical reuse of Cultural He
creator: Antonia Bobik
sourceDescription: Join us on a journey through time

title: ECHOES / ECCCH Second Call
content: This cascading grants call aims to support initiatives that strengthen collaboration, skills development, and community building within the European cultural heritage ecosystem.
creator: Antonia Bobik
sourceDescription: Join us on a journey through time

title: 3D Digitisation: Prepare for Success
content: This new training opportunity represents an important step in building capacity across Europe’s cultural heritage sector and supporting the effective use of 3D technologies in the digital realm.
creator: Antonia Bobik
sourceDescription: Join us on a journey through time

title: Unlock 3D Potential with 3DBigDataSpace Training at the Hunt Museum
content: The Hunt Museum is thrilled to offer a practical, inclusive 3D‑training series under 3DBigDataSpace designed to help cultural heritage professionals take the leap into 3D digitisation, modelling, fabrication and accessible display.
creator: Antonia Bobik
sourceDescription: Join us on a journey through time

title: Official Programme Now Available!
content: We’re thrilled to announce that the official programme for our first 3D-4CH Winter School, taking place next year in Brussels, is now live! This exciting three-day event brings together colleagues from across Europe to explore the world of 3D in cultural heritage, combining inspiring lectures, hands-on workshops, and collaborative sessions to advance our Online Competence […]
creator: Antonia Bobik
sourceDescription: Join us on a journey through time

title: Supporting Culture for AI: Shaping Responsible AI in Cultural Heritage
content: At the Fantastic Futures Conference 2025, the Time Machine Organisation, as member of the AI4LAM community, is looking forward to supporting the collaboration on “Culture for AI: Formulating an Alignment”: a participatory initiative exploring how the digital heritage community can shape responsible AI. Cultural heritage institutions have long been drivers of digital innovation. They don’t […]
creator: Antonia Bobik
sourceDescription: Join us on a journey through time

title: Extended Reality Brings Milan’s Urban Memory to Life
content: Milan has launched ARchivi – The Milan You Didn’t Know in Augmented Reality, an innovative project that turns the city into an open cultural ecosystem.
creator: Antonia Bobik
sourceDescription: Join us on a journey through time

title: Empowering Youth Through Digital Heritage Skills
content: How can digital tools help safeguard cultural memory in one of the world’s most historically layered cities? Sensing Jerusalem is a new collaborative digital art–making and skills-building initiative designed to empower young Palestinians through hands-on training in digital heritage technologies. The team together with external experts in digital humanities, will deliver a series of capacity-buil
creator: Antonia Bobik
sourceDescription: Join us on a journey through time

title: Safeguarding European Archives for a Sustainable Future
content: The International Council on Archives has released the latest edition of FLASH, its biannual digital magazine featuring an in-depth look at SAGA (Sustainable Archives and Greener Approaches), written by the Head of International Cooperation at the Spanish State Archives. The article highlights why documentary heritage is crucial for identity, collective memory, and community resilience, especially
creator: Antonia Bobik
sourceDescription: Join us on a journey through time

title: Empowering Europe’s Digital Heritage Through Cross-Project Collaboration
content: As part of the 30th CHNT in Vienna, we had the chance to showcase our commitment to building a connected and data-rich future for European Cultural Heritage through our project participations.
creator: Antonia Bobik
sourceDescription: Join us on a journey through time

title: MetaHeritage Webinar Series Kicks Off: Empowering SMEs and Innovators Across Europe
content: The MetaHeritage project has officially launched its Webinar Series, designed to guide SMEs, clusters, and regional innovation stakeholders through the landscape of European collaboration, technology adoption, and funding opportunities.
creator: Antonia Bobik
sourceDescription: Join us on a journey through time

title: Exploring Digital Approaches to Cultural Heritage at the University of Salzburg
content: The Digital History Conference takes place in autumn 2026 at the Department of History. It will place cultural heritage at its core embedding it in a wider discussion on “Doing Cultural Heritage.”
creator: Antonia Bobik
sourceDescription: Join us on a journey through time
